name: Cuban Inspired Millet
author: asjlachuk
summary: My Cuban suegra taught me how to make a sofrito. I used this same process (without tomatoes and plus a carrot) to enhance millet. Serve warm or cold.
ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro, or more to taste
directions: Blend carrot and garlic in a food processor until finely chopped
Heat olive oil in a pot over medium heat; cook and stir carrot mixture, onion, and green bell pepper until softened, about 10 minutes
Add millet; stir until fragrant and toasted, about 3 minutes
Pour vegetable broth into millet mixture; season with salt and black pepper
Reduce heat and simmer until all the broth is absorbed and millet is tender, about 20 minutes
